remarks: A set is finite iff it is strictly dominated by the class of natural number.  Theorem 42 of [Suppes] p. 151.  In order to avoid the Axiom of infinity, we include it as a hypothesis.  (Contributed by NM, 3-Nov-2002.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)
statement: isfiniteg $p |- ( _om e. _V -> ( A e. Fin <-> A ~< _om ) ) $.
